storyInfo: The Iberian mission and the Abyssal Hunters arrive at the underwater city of Milliarium. Jordi and Irene find themselves in a strange environment and civilization.

attributes.content: Based on geological conditions, it's a promising volcano, but the location is less than optimal.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher A

attributes.content: It would be difficult to establish a lengthy energy transportation pipeline while fending off Seaborn attacks.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher A

attributes.content: Did you read the Academy of Technology's report?
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher B

attributes.content: Hydrogen from seawater can be used to maintain operation of the Legion fleet, but it would be difficult to guarantee uninterrupted energy supply to the beacon.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher B

attributes.content: It alone accounts for half of the entire city's energy consumption.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher B

attributes.content: It used to be much worse. Our ancestors had to design a bio-energy system for it, maintained through the joint effort of a dozen cities.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher A

attributes.content: In this day and age, a system like that would be attacked by the Seaborn before it could even be activated.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher A

attributes.content: Regardless, we need to find a way to ensure power supply for the beacon.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher B

attributes.content: Maybe Appius would know a way. Let me get in... oh!
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher A

attributes.content: Did you forget? He's still in the home territories and our cities are under radio silence.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher B

attributes.content: We can't exactly lay fiber optic cables like we used to, either, what with all the Seaborn out there.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher B

attributes.content: I miss the days when we could get anyone in the country on a holographic call whenever we wanted.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher A

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher B

attributes.content: What if we modified the output mode of the energy converter?
attributes.name: Ægir Researcher B

attributes.content: We have extremely limited experience in this area. There's always a safety risk.
attributes.name: Ægir Doctor

attributes.content: With you in charge of the cognitive link, I believe the risk is reasonable.
attributes.name: Ægir Scholar

attributes.content: Well, I'm glad you're that confident in me, but I'm not. Who knows what an extended conversation via cognitive link with our transformed countrymen would do to both our minds?
attributes.name: Ægir Doctor

attributes.content: There's been plenty of research into this. We'll be good as long as you keep a steady hand.
attributes.name: Ægir Scholar

attributes.content: Even in the home territories, there are very few cases of transformed citizens being granted a final interview. Most are simply euthanized.
attributes.name: Ægir Doctor

attributes.content: Consul Clementia's ideas are radical, as always.
attributes.name: Ægir Doctor

attributes.content: Which is exactly why I followed her here.
attributes.name: Ægir Scholar

attributes.content: By sorting through the threads of reason via conversation, we can grant them a chance to leave a final trace of their sapience in the world.
attributes.name: Ægir Scholar

attributes.content: And what better way to send them off than with a stimulating debate?
attributes.name: Ægir Scholar

attributes.content: Sadly, most of the survivors the Sea Patrol brings back are already transformed beyond recognition. Precious few have the opportunity to return to the city to receive a final interview.
attributes.name: Ægir Scholar

attributes.content: Say—
attributes.name: Ægir Doctor

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Ægir Scholar

attributes.content: We're witnessing history unfold here, aren't we?
attributes.name: Ægir Doctor

attributes.content: Or maybe we're just doing our jobs. I trust that the Institute of Development Planning's faith in you is not misplaced. Make your preparations.
attributes.name: Ægir Scholar

attributes.content: Thanks. See you in the isolation chamber.
attributes.name: Ægir Doctor

attributes.content: Excuse me—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: W-What the? A Catastrophe? Under the sea?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Taken by surprise, the young man loses balance and falls, but an even stranger sight stifles his cry of surprise—
He sees the passersby float into the air, swimming through it like fins through water, paying little heed to the swaying city below.
As things return to normal, some land and walk away—continuing their conversations like nothing had happened—while others continue to swim forward through the air.
He recalls the Ægir rituals the people of Gran Faro had told him about when he was little.
Get up, Jordi.
R-right!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Doña Irene?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Next time you go out, remember to put on the device that the Sea Patrol gave us when we landed yesterday.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Right, I remember that from the briefing videos... Which one was it again...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The fourth one. The technicians at the port reminded me.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: They make regular adjustments to the gravity settings, as part of what it takes to maintain the low-gravity environment of Milliarium.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: They said it's like a fin adjusting its swim bladder.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: So you went to tour the port.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Yes. I was interested in their ships and docks, their weapons... those massive ships that sail like fowlbeasts through reefs and cliffs.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I saw traces of the Stultifera Navis in them. Breogan really did recreate Ægir technology in Iberia. Perhaps...
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Perhaps we should have sailed our proud armada out into the vast oceans, rather than parading our gold-gilded ships along the coasts as a deterrent to those dukes and pashas.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Breogan...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You look nervous, Jordi. So nervous that you missed the point entirely.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I'm just feeling a little out of place...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: This place is stranger than I imagined. The air is thick and heavy, the ocean above my head sends a chill up my spine, and the glowing plants along the streets make me dizzy.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Plus what happened just now...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Physical discomfort, I could deal with, but there are so many oddities here I can't even begin to understand yet.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The briefing videos Ægir provided were very detailed, but there's still so much that I couldn't comprehend, even after rewatching them so many times.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Food moves on its own without a fork. Clothes clean themselves without having to be removed. These things make sense, kind of.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But Edible Sagas? Crunchy Theorems? I just can't wrap my head around those. The best I can do for now is print out one of those emergency nutrition supply devices.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: All my life I've known nothing but Gran Faro. Is this what it's like to...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: No, it's not quite like an Iberian from a backwater village seeing the capital for the first time. Not that the City of Gold still exists.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The difference here isn't one between a small town and a metropolis, but... almost between two entirely different civilizations.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I tried to ask someone for directions, but couldn't understand what they were saying, or whether I was being rude to interrupt.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I don't even know how they see me—an Ægir in name only.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I have my concerns, too.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: You're worried too?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You of all people know what Iberia did to the Ægir after the Profound Silence.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I don't know what kind of country Ægir is, how its people view that period of bloodshed, or how they view me—an emissary with blood on her hands.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: But you didn't—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'm here representing the Iberian Inquisition. I've seen the files on the slaughters... Each report on its own may be thin, but in aggregate...
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: We committed many injustices while cleansing the influence of the Church of the Deep, and the Islanders were the most affected.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I still believe the Inquisition was in no position to be lenient, not when the country itself teetered on the brink.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: It was our collective decision that we should go to any lengths to ensure the nation's survival in a time of extraordinary crisis.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: But that does not lessen our crime.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I don't believe you need worry about that.
Growing a massive vesicle to resist a blast from Class III weaponry, and covering the retreat of the other Seaborn into the depths of the trench...
attributes.name: Haggard Scholar

attributes.content: How is it even possible for biological tissue to be made to resist the forces of a micro-singularity?
attributes.name: Haggard Scholar

attributes.content: The Sea Patrol brought back tissue samples. They've already been sent to your lab through the transport tubes.
attributes.name: Astute Officer

attributes.content: At least they haven't yet developed a collective resistance to Class III weaponry like they have for Classes I and II.
attributes.name: Haggard Scholar

attributes.content: The performance of Class III weaponry is demonstrably superior.
attributes.name: Astute Officer

attributes.content: But even more concerning is that an individual Seaborn has evolved measures specifically to counter it. They're more... organized than before.
attributes.name: Astute Officer

attributes.content: You've been analyzing the Seaborn's adaptation to various weaponry ever since Milliarium set sail. Did you already foresee this?
attributes.name: Astute Officer

attributes.content: Advisor Blandus?
attributes.name: Astute Officer

attributes.content: To an extent. But we need more time to confirm our theories.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Thank you, Secunda.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Your reports are always so detailed I dare not blink for fear of missing something. Little Handy, get me some eyedrops.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Ignore that command, Little Handy. Just a bad joke.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: If there's nothing else, I'll be going. I need to speak to the technicians about the damage suffered by our ships.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: I'd rather you stay just a while longer, unless you're hurrying to get some rest after work.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Isn't it somewhat ironic, considering you've also received numerous health warnings but haven't seen a doctor yet?
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: ...Very well. Still, I'd appreciate it if you could hear me out. It won't take long. I just need to confirm something—
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Have you read Gladiia's report?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: I have.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Then you should know about Ulpianus. I thought you'd at least show some sort of reaction.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Of course I'm concerned about the reappearance of the Abyssal Hunters after five years of silence. Especially when the Waterway Program is at a key juncture.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: And Ulpianus's unusual activities are of particular note.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: He clearly made contact with Gladiia's group and is aware of Milliarium, but has made no attempt to reestablish communications with Ægir.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Meanwhile, we've heard from our Iberian sources that he's also declined to work with Iberia.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: He may be proud—arrogant even—but he is no fool. He must have his reasons for acting alone.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Regardless, I intend to find out where he is and what he's planning.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: That utilitarianism, that impatience... he's rubbed off on you. We had hoped you'd be better than that.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: I can only pray your decision-making will be more prudent while tracking him.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Nevertheless, I have faith that you'll keep me updated on his whereabouts.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: What are you talking about, Advisor Blandus?
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Neither of us is part of the Abyssal Hunter program anymore.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: You're the weapons technology advisor for the Waterway Program now. Aren't utilitarian, impatient decisions the usual business in your field?
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: And shouldn't you be getting information about Ulpianus from Milliarium's official sources? Why involve me?
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Of course, of course.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: Just a momentary lapse in judgment. I can't fault you for carrying out your duty as Praefecta of the Sea Patrol.
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: I just ask that you remember what Ulpianus did for us, for Ægir.
attributes.name: Blandus
Secunda
attributes.content: Yes, speaking.

attributes.name: Secunda
attributes.content: What? Missing?!
I'm on my way.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Who's missing?
attributes.name: Blandus

attributes.content: One of the technicians on the Waterway Program has gone AWOL.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: And you are...?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Avitus, from the Institute of Prehistoric Studies, Academy of Science. We study the documents and artifacts of the prehistoric civilization.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Irene, emissary of the Iberian Inquisition.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Jordi. Jordi Fontanarossa.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: A pleasure to make your acquaintance.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: And don't worry, I didn't come to lecture you. I simply felt it was my duty as a citizen of Ægir to free our landbound friends from their needless concerns.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Needless concerns?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: What I mean to say is, Ægir understands that Iberia took measures proportionate to the extraordinary nature of the times.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: We can find similar periods in our own history, or even that of the glorious prehistoric civilization.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: The exclusion of outsiders as a necessary means of maintaining social order appears to be an inevitable step in the progress of civilization.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Besides, we welcome our displaced countrymen to return to the sea, just as we respect the decision of those who have opted to leave.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: The consequences of their choices belong only to them.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: I appreciate Ægir's magnanimity, Avitus, but the 'consequences' they suffered were...
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: No, it's nothing. Thank you for clarifying.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: You're welcome—
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Mr. Avitus, our landbound guests, please be informed that this area has been designated for investigation.
attributes.name: 'Little Handy'

attributes.content: You are advised to proceed to another area unless you have unresolved matters here.
attributes.name: 'Little Handy'

attributes.content: A Hand of the Saint?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The Penal Battalion used them to clean up Seaborn remains, but I never knew they could talk.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Apparently, our people who brought them to land did not have time to demonstrate their full capabilities.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Multi-purpose Support Equipment, commonly known as a 'Little Handy.' They currently offer 972 different function modules, excluding obsolete ones.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: One can sometimes tell their affiliation just by looking at the parts and paintjob. This one, for example, belongs to the Sea Patrol.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Er, should I reply?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Um, we're very sorry, Little Handy, er, sir.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That would be unnecessary. It may be equipped with a voice, but that doesn't mean it's intelligent.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: I assumed that with your technology, maybe...
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: It's true that the topic of simulated personalities has fascinated many a researcher.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: The first attempt was created 230 years ago and continues to operate to this day. In fact, I can put in an application for you, if you wish to talk to it.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: However, whether from the perspective of neuroscience, psychology, sociology, or anthropology, simulated personalities have proven to be rather disappointing in terms of their benefits to research.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Perhaps I've gone off topic, though. In short, they've remained the stuff of niche research, and we do not consider them suitable for widespread application.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: The goal of all technological development is to empower humanity. What purpose is there in turning a machine into a human?
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: I see. Fascinating.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You said this Little Handy belonged to the Sea Patrol?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Only they would fit such powerful loudspeakers onto one, when quieter means of communication are available. I suppose you could consider it retro?
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: What sort of organization are they? Do they frequently undertake such investigations?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The Sea Patrol is part of our Legions. They perform a supporting role in combat, as well as regular reconnaissance, patrol, security, and disaster response duties.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Emergency sweeps like this are rare, but with the Waterway Program at such a critical moment, it's only reasonable for them to be on high alert.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Little Handy, am I allowed to remain here?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: It is not recommended, but not forbidden.
attributes.name: 'Little Handy'

attributes.content: Then I'll wait here. I'd like a chance to speak to the Sea Patrol.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Very well. And you, Jordi?
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: I'll be going. Do you mind if I ask you some questions?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Of course not. There's a limit to what I can answer outside of my specialty, though.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Perhaps I could show you to a place better suited for such a conversation.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: The Sophontheatrum.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Did you sleep well, Doctor? You seem a little haggard.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: It's the air pressure. And humidity.

attributes.content: Yes, the Ægir seem to have retained some of their aquatic traits.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Are you not feeling well?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Just a little short of breath.

attributes.content: Is it serious?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Let me know if you feel any discomfort.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Besides...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: To be frank, I thought there may be another reason for your reaction.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Does anything about Ægir or the depths of the ocean seem familiar to you?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: A little, but—no, not here.;...;Maybe, but only vaguely.

attributes.content: So you do remember something?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm accustomed to your usual silence, but now it's making me a little uneasy.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know it might be difficult, but remembering even the slightest detail could be of great help to us all.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Sorry, I can't remember anything else.

attributes.content: It's okay, just try to relax, Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Seeing the Preserver has inevitably hastened the pace at which you recall the truth... Even though I had hoped you would not touch upon what you'd forgotten so quickly.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No one knows when your path of suffering will end. Not even yourself. In that, we are all powerless.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What we do know is that you've had an encounter with the abyss. The ocean is yet another path to your past, and we are finally upon it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: You seem excited.;Do I detect... satisfaction?

attributes.content: Yes. I've wanted to set foot in Ægir countless times.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Until now, I have waited on the shore, and drifted on the waves.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I have witnessed lighthouses and the armada turn from ideas to reality. Breogan had never given up on reestablishing communication with Ægir through such means.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But all his efforts ended in failure. Ægir never welcomed home their prodigal son, much less opened their doors to outsiders.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But now, they are even more eager to cooperate than I had anticipated. We need no longer waste efforts to persuade a proud and aloof giant.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I can't deny feeling happy about that.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: You don't look particularly happy.;Is there something else troubling you?

attributes.content: I'm afraid there is.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ægir's proactive stance indicates that they have a plan for making contact with the land.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But even the most moderate of their measures may seem too radical for landbound civilization. A single gesture of goodwill could cause a massive storm.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: We should intervene as soon as possible.
The Abyssal Hunters are a good entry point.

attributes.content: The Hunters' situation warrants concern, too.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: To Ægir, they are neither emissaries nor guests.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Having participated in the most radical project in Ægir's history, and 'come back to life' after being declared dead for five years... I worry that their return home would only cause—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Trouble?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Controversy?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Where's Gladiia?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A somewhat troublesome fellow called her away.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I thought your priority upon returning would be to get checked up. What could possibly be more urgent?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No idea.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: But once Gladiia's done with her interview, I guess Skadi and I are gonna go do some stupid check-up.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Swordfish and I are fine. Shark's changes might be a little problematic.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.options: There's no Originium in the ocean, is there?;Does Ægir understand Oripathy?

attributes.content: I read some medical papers before I underwent the surgery.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Even back then, they had advanced knowledge of medulla regeneration and replacement. They should be able to help her.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You needn't worry, Doctor.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I've inspected myself in the mirror on that great ship. On returning, those endless dreams still creep up on me like bubbles, but they've also become as light as bubbles.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Besides, I feel like I'd have more regrets about losing those dreams.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: But for now, I'm as lucid as I've ever been. And luckily for you, I'm even in the mood to take you on a tour of the city.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Interested?
attributes.name: Specter
